name: Notice of Proceedings: NOP AE1 (court service UK)
body:
#Notice of proceedings

Case number: ((reference number))

Dear ((first name)) ((last name)),

Your ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)) has been checked by court staff and accepted. Your case reference number is: ((reference number)).

#What happens next
Your ((partner)) has been sent the ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)). They need to read the application and respond by ((review deadline date)). You do not need to do anything.

You will receive a notification when they have responded. If they do not respond then you will be told what you can do next to progress the application.

You can track the progress of your ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)) here: ((signin url))

The next step in the ((isDivorce??divorce process))((isDissolution??process to end your civil partnership)) is to apply for a ‘conditional order’. You have to wait until ((date of response)) until you can apply. You will receive a notification with details of how you can apply.

#Dividing your money and property
Dividing money and property is dealt with separately to the ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)).

It’s usually more straightforward and less expensive if you agree with your ((partner)) on how to divide your money and property. Get help agreeing: https://www.gov.uk/money-property-when-relationship-ends/mediation

If you do agree then you can make the agreement legally binding. This is known as asking the court to make a ‘consent order’. Read more about consent orders: https://www.gov.uk/money-property-when-relationship-ends/apply-for-consent-order

If you disagree then you can ask the court to decide for you. This is known as applying for a ‘financial order’. Read more about financial orders: https://www.gov.uk/money-property-when-relationship-ends/get-court-to-decide

#Help and assistance
You can find guidance on these websites:
GOV.UK: ((isDivorce??https://www.gov.uk/divorce))((isDissolution??https://www.gov.uk/end-civil-partnership))
Citizens Advice: ((isDivorce??https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/family/how-to-separate1/getting-a-divorce/))((isDissolution??https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/family/how-to-separate1/ending-a-civil-partnership/))
Advicenow: https://www.advicenow.org.uk/guides/how-get-divorce-or-end-civil-partnership-without-lawyer

If you have any questions, then you can contact the ((isDivorce??divorce service))((isDissolution??End A Civil Partnership Service)) using the contact details below. The advisors cannot give you legal advice.

Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)

This is an automated message, please do not reply to this email.
Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email.
